website_summaries.verdict: A simple, no-fuss solution for adults who want to keep baby close while doing other things.
pros: A simple approach to carrying your baby that promotes physical bonding
cons: Wearer and child can get hot and sweaty

website_summaries.verdict: An excellent option, especially if you need the extra length. You won't find a better baby wrap on the market today.
pros: Features soft but strong, no-sag construction
Comes in 10 fashionable colors – more than any of the others we considered
cons: At 5 1/2 yards, its length makes it difficult to tie for smaller babies
It's also slightly more costly than others on our list

website_summaries.verdict: Easily ranked as a high-quality baby sling at an affordable price point. It's not only sturdy and comfortable, but is customizable, simple to use, and well-suited to a wide range of women's sizes.
pros: This sling stands out for its support, comfort, and ease in storing, washing, and packing
We love that it  accommodate a range of infant sizes, helps ease back pain and fits plus size women
cons: The longer length of this sling makes it a bit more cumbersome, especially for petite women
Some consumers also felt the learning curve for wrapping could be improved upon

customer_reviews.title: I really like the Boba wrap
customer_reviews.text: I really like the Boba wrap. Everytime my baby is in the wrap she falls asleep. I am a first time wrapper and I only watched one YouTube video and learned how to wrap it. This wrap is a bit warm and will sometimes cause my baby to sweat but right now it is still cool where I live. Once it warms up I will probably have to get a thinner wrap. I've also noticed when I where it for an extended period of time my back starts to hurt, but that is to be expected if you are carrying a whole extra person around for hours with just the support of fabric. Overall a good product
customer_reviews.author: Brittany C. Grant

customer_reviews.title: Great for plus size mom's
customer_reviews.text: So happy I gave baby wearing another try with this Boba. I was struggling to find a comfortable wrap for a plus size mom. I'm a dress size 18, and bra size 44D. The last wrap I bought squished my baby into my boobs. This wrap is comfortable for myself and my baby. She is currently 11 pounds and fits fine. Would recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: hetzie21

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This product is wonderful! There is a bit of a learning curve with this. Once you get the hang of getting it wrapped snugly and tucking a baby in by yourself, this thing rocks! We have twins and we can fit both at the same time. If you can get the wrap tight enough, this will securely hold your precious cargo. Another great thing, this wrap is big. If you've got a few extra pound, like myself, fear not. It will fit. Again, I'm on the heavy side and can pack twins in here.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Love our boba wrap.
customer_reviews.text: My 2 month old loves this wrap and I take him everywhere in it; the grocery store, baseball games, around the house, etc. It's helped so much during his fussy times, we cannot live without it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Babywearing is truly magical
customer_reviews.text: I'm a grandma who does lots of babysitting and I love babywearing, and the Boba wrap. My only complain is that it gets hot indoors but it is perfect for winter walks. We just got the Mumma wrap, pretty much the same but lighter, so we are set for summer times. Babywearing is truly magical, it is a lovely way to snuggle for hours.
customer_reviews.author: sylvaniux

customer_reviews.title: Not what thought.
customer_reviews.text: As bit disappointed with this . We one size fits all theoryMore often than not does not alway work for everybody. I found that when I would tie it up on the side I have a lot of extra material singing and was a bit frustrating and 85° weather. Just too hot I have a call that material wrapped around you. I had to revert back to my Bjorn. I was really hoping with my second child I will have something I could keep her closer to me. There are a lot of other similar products I picked this one because of seemed to be what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia M. Haugh

customer_reviews.title: I love this wrap! Grows with your changing body and keeps baby secure!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried a few wraps out there - but this one - this is the real thing! Many other wraps require you buy a certain size (S, M, L, etc) - this isn't helpful as your body grows or slims with pregnancy. This wrap is extremely versatile, as it moves and grows with you. I've fluxed approximately 60lbs and can still wear this sling snug and tight throughout my body's changes. Also, the product itself is very well made - the fabric is high quality and there's plenty of it to securely swaddle both you and your child, together. I will most definitely be purchasing a second one in the near future! Bonus: so many great color options!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Versatile carrier!
customer_reviews.text: Love this addition for holding my wee one. It’s such a comfortable way to carry her around and still have my hands free. I am surprised how much I like it and that it took my third child to be brave enough to try it. I solely used a more rigid option but wanted to try a wrap out. My baby loves it! It certainly has a lot of stretch and can be used on many sizes and body shapes for all adult family members to have a carrying option. As some carriers can be pretty pricey this one is probably your best bargain! Watch you tube or go to boba site to get your wrapping technique right!
customer_reviews.author: Jessi M

customer_reviews.title: Life Saver!
customer_reviews.text: This wrap was more than what I expected. I absolutely love it. I'm plus size and worried it wouldn't fit around but it did perfectly. My baby boy is so cozy in it and falls asleep. Even when he's cranky I put him in it and walk around the house it soothes him. I can now wash dishes and vacuum and still give him the extra loves and cuddles he needs and I want!
customer_reviews.author: Shay

customer_reviews.title: Not good for Arizona for sure. Too hot!
customer_reviews.text: Too hot for the baby and it takes too long to put it on, it's super long and not practical for shorter people like myself. Not fun when you're in the process of putting it on and it hits the ground and you are out in public places where it's dirty and gross.
customer_reviews.author: Ellie

customer_reviews.title: Not tight enough,
customer_reviews.text: I just don’t like it. Doesn’t seem like baby is comfortable. The fabric stretches, so no matter how tight you tie it, it starts to feel loose, I felt like my baby would drop. The material also is very warm, so not good for use in spring or summer. The videos show you to to put the baby on, but not how to take the baby off. This was also caused discomfort to my 3month old. I thought these fabric carriers would be good option because my African mom used fabric to carry me around her back, but I see why we advanced and created the other kinds.
customer_reviews.author: SoSaol

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a pain!
customer_reviews.text: You have to wrap this thing around you for like 15 minutes. When you get good it might only take 5, but it has to wrap several times. The other problem is that it is hot, so if you are like me, you most likely will not be able to use it. All the product consist of is a stretchy piece of cloth about 10 feet long that narrows at both ends, but in general is about 20 inches wide.
customer_reviews.author: Langham

customer_reviews.title: Not a good buy, but I will reuse the material for ...
customer_reviews.text: The feed back from 2 mom's... They have it back to me and said it was hard to get adjusted and keep baby secure. Another mom is tiny, and had half the fabric hanging after following instructions. Not a good buy, but I will reuse the material for little blankets...
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Goettl

customer_reviews.title: My baby hated it but every child is different.
customer_reviews.text: My baby is always wanting to be in my arms which makes getting things done pretty much impossible. I bought this wrap in hopes to keep baby by me and have free arms. I watched some YouTube videos on how to wrap it and once you get it down it's not hard. But my baby HATED it. By the time I tried to put the baby into the wrap she was screaming bloody murder so I had to take her out. I returned the product as my baby did not like it. But every baby is different so I will still recommend this product. Also it's super long so it will fit any sized person.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Very stretchy, great for new baby
customer_reviews.text: Love this wrap! I got the Boba and a Moby and I prefer the Boba so far for my 12lb 3 month old. It is very stretchy, stretchier than the Moby and the more expensive cotton stretch wrap I was gifted. The stretchiness makes is very comfortable, but less supportive, so I suspect I'll prefer the more supportive wraps as she gets bigger and the weather cools off. This one's the winner for now though! I love that you can wrap it tight to wear without the baby, then just pop her in and out as needed. This got us through a 12 hour two flight plane trip perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: These socks suck

customer_reviews.title: A guy that enjoys my Boba
customer_reviews.text: I saw this and was intrigued. I assumed it was just for young, skinny, white suburban moms. Not today. I’m a 43 year old, big, Puerto Rican suburban daddy and I love skin time with my daughter. This pandemic keeps me from going out but by the time I do this is my carrier. LOVE IT.
customer_reviews.author: Peter R.

customer_reviews.title: Life changer!
customer_reviews.text: I was sceptical on using a wrap but loved it the first time I put it on. The minute I first removed it from its box i instantly was scared to tr thg it since it was well over my size! After reading the instructions on how to properly put it on and slip the baby in, I didn't want to take it off! Was very easy to put on if you follow the step by step guide to put it on. Very comfortable, and keeps baby secure while I gets to be hands free for other tasks.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: A total lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about purchasing a wrap for my baby but was struggling around week 2. My girlfriend recommended the Boba wrap and I mentioned it to my husband. He suggested we “try it out”. Well, it’s a total lifesaver. Nothing feels more cozy than having my little-one sneggled up against me - and I am able to use my TWO hands for other things. Yay!!! (Side note - I watched like 5 YouTube videos about the boba wrap to ensure I was doing it correctly.... I recommend anyone who purchases this watch videos about how to PROPERLY place your baby in the wrap).
customer_reviews.author: Tee-Ro

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for newborns
customer_reviews.text: I love this wrap for my newborn. It is good up to about 15lbs. After that, it's not very comfortable anymore. But we used it constantly for the first few months! My baby loved to sleep in this wrap. It helped calm her down & make her feel secure. I love it. I watched a Youtube video to know how to tie it properly.
customer_reviews.author: LoveMyAmazon_24

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for us.
customer_reviews.text: The fabric of this wrap is heavenly. My baby hated it though- I think because of how her head had to be positioned for safety. In addition, I don't see how I could have used this out and about. The fabric is so long that it's going to drag all over the ground or floor. Can you imagine putting your baby in fabric that dragged over a parking lot? If you only plan to use this around the house, it's very soft, stretchy, and adjustable. Give it a try and maybe your baby will enjoy it more than mine did. If they don't, returns are painless.
customer_reviews.author: scarlette

customer_reviews.title: I wish it was a more breathable fabric but I do love how comfortable it is!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this wrap!! It is so easy to put on. I’ve used this when my baby was a newborn and now she’s 3 months old and I still use it. I love how comfortable it is for both my baby and me. I love how she is able to look around where we are going. So cute! It’s also soft and stretchy. I will say though it can be very warm to wear on long walks or hikes. I kinda sweat a bit and had to wear a tank top only while wearing it on a hike. In that aspect I wish it was a more breathable fabric.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: Buy it.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this thing! My daughter falls asleep in it EVERY time I put her in it. That is not an exaggeration... it’s very comfortable and there is less strain after long use. I noticed with my baby bjorn , more back pain after something like a trip to the zoo. I haven’t worn the baby bjorn since receiving this one. Love love love it!! The only con is that it can get a bit hot at times when we have been outside for a while. Not a big deal, a normal thing for having a bunch of cloth and a child wrapped on you. All in all it’s amazing and I definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nope.
customer_reviews.text: I did not like this wrap at all. I am returning it. The material very thick and heavy and there is just SO much material! I can’t imagien getting out of my car and wrapping this around me... the material would be all over the ground! Nope... I’ll stick to a traditional carrier!
customer_reviews.author: Dana Webb

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for fussy babies who like to be walked.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this wrap for a month now and I love it. It takes about 5 minutes to put on and get your little one comfortable so it’s not as instant as some baby carriers I’m sure but that is okay for me. I have a fussy baby who likes to be walked around and having her in this makes it possible to actually get stuff done, and within 10 minutes of being in here she is asleep. I have a different carrier that is easier to get on for the store and walks outside but this is the one I use in the house as it is much softer.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie

customer_reviews.title: Better than Baby K'tan!
customer_reviews.text: Love this wrap! Although it is too hot for wearing in the heat of summer, it is perfect for cool weather! Love the material, soft for baby's skin. It is somewhat a pain to put on at first but once you figure it out it's no problem. I was gifted a Baby K'tan wrap and the Boba is much better! The K'tan is not adjustable so husband can't wear it and I'm petite and it doesn't fit me properly so it puts a lot of strain on my shoulders. My little girl isn't comfortable in it either.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and very versatile
customer_reviews.text: I tried a couple different wraps and I highly preferred this wrap. It was so easy to use and I felt like my little one was very secure and not going to fall out. There are many different ways that you can tie this wrap as your baby grows so it can be used for quite a while. The material is a little thicker so it was great in the winter but did get a little warm as the weather warmed up. The knots have always stayed in place so the baby stays snug as a bug and you don't have sagging baby an hour or two later.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Hands free and happy
customer_reviews.text: This wrap has been a lifesaver. I nurse my 3 month old full time and he can be very demanding. We purchased this wrap over the cheaper ones and I’m glad that we invested in this choice. The material is thick and sturdy, and the length and stretchability allows for flexibility with different wrap styles. I’ve looked up a few on YouTube and they have worked out great. As for baby, he loves it. He gets to be in the mix with mom while still being snuggled comfortably. If you’re contemplating this one and another Of a similar style, just go with this choice. It’s worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Sweetz Divine

customer_reviews.title: Meh. Works but not as well as hoped.
customer_reviews.text: It takes awhile to get used to but once you get the hang of tying it, this wrap does allow for hands free carrying your little one. However it’s not very breathable; our daughter always comes out really warm to the touch. I thought at first I was tying too loosely (she sits too low and doesn’t feel secure) then too tightly (she sits at the correct height but now my back hurts); either way she’s warm to the touch while only wearing a onesie. All things considered, it does work but for the cost, I would’ve probably tried another hands free carrier.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Y.

customer_reviews.title: You don’t know what you’re missing!
customer_reviews.text: If you have never used one of these wraps before or just look at it and think “but can they fall out?” or, “is it too tight in the baby?” No and no. Everything that you question when looking at this will be answered once you see how it works and how it fits. It is safer and more comfortable than any carrier strapped to your back or front. Amazing product. Could not recommend this enough!
customer_reviews.author: Kendall Jones

customer_reviews.title: Stretchy and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I'm still learning how to use this wrap and get comfortable wrapping one baby. I have twins and I haven't tried doing both at the same time yet but we've only been home from the hospital for a couple weeks so I haven't had much occasion to use it yet. I'm just starting to use it around the house. I like the gray because I'm hoping my husband might use it too but I kind of wish I got the purple :) So get the color you want and practice, practice! This is going to be useful once I'm proficient.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Ownby

customer_reviews.title: Perfect when you don't have an infant carseat
customer_reviews.text: I love this!! We bought a carseat that grows with our baby, so it stays in the car. This makes it a lot easier to get to and from the car!! I also like it because if I am carrying her in this people don't try to touch her like they do if she is in the stroller. I'm plus-size so I was worried about it getting all the way around me and I have no problems at all! Love this product.
customer_reviews.author: AmyBrown

customer_reviews.title: Too stretchy but useful
customer_reviews.text: I love how stretchy the material is when putting baby in, but I hate how it makes my baby go down and down, as I walk. Perhaps I am supposed to hold the baby all the time to keep that from happening, but then it defeats the purpose of having to use one of these. I like the feel of the material and how it is practia to use, but hate how much I need to do to use it. Also, I have tried several times to use it with the baby, but she doesn't seem to like being in it.
customer_reviews.author: Alba L

customer_reviews.title: Inconvenient, too hot
customer_reviews.text: The cloth is way too long - it’s nearly impossible to get it on without it touching the ground. It is super hot because of all the layers of wrapping and takes a while to put on. I might have been able to get past these things if my baby liked it, but she didn’t. We ended up going with the ergobaby with the infant insert instead.
customer_reviews.author: Mallory

customer_reviews.title: Great for my newborn
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy this wrap and my now 11 week old son loves it as well. He will sleep in it while I work from home or grocery shop. It is simple to wrap and use. However, after the first time wearing it the fabric started to snag. Also this was supposed to come with a carrying bag, which was missing from my package. I wish I could give this 5 stars but the missing bag and snagging are disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
customer_reviews.text: YES - FINALLY !! I love this BOBA WRAP !! We have tried several other wraps/slings since our baby was born, but none provided me the comfort needed to feel safe letting my baby hang hands-free. I always felt he would fall out the bottom, but with the BOBA WRAP, we can jump, sway, and be free knowing our baby is secure. Plus, we look stylish wearing this wrap, it’s long enough to even wear it as a shirt so to be skin to skin all day. We can easily breastfeed and still be covered effortlessly !! GREAT BUY !!
customer_reviews.author: Kat & Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Not a light weight material
customer_reviews.text: Material was thicker and hotter than I expected. I’ve had a Moby in the past and it feels much thicker than that. It’s easy to use and my son likes being in it. I had hoped it would be good for summer use, but it may get too hot. With it being thick the part on the shoulders seem very wide. Color was spot on and was as described.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Life saver!
customer_reviews.text: My infant son loves to be held upright. This wrap has been a life saver. When I need to do things around the house & he wants to be held I put him in the wrap & he sleeps. It's also nice for grocery shopping, walks, etc. He loves it! I was concerned about it being a pain in the ass to wrap. It was a bit intimidating, as the wrap is basically a super long, stretchy fabric material, however it was surprisingly easy with the instructions provided.
customer_reviews.author: blbupstate

customer_reviews.title: Not organic
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the "Gray" wrap because the product descriptions for all colors said organic cotton, but called the company after receiving it since nothing on packaging noted organic and they confirmed only the "Organic Dark Gray" color is organic cotton, and that color doesn't even show up as option anymore. If looking for organic material, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Timm

customer_reviews.title: Money well spent!
customer_reviews.text: This wrap is amazing! My son is 7 months and I still use it every single day. He loves to snuggle and he loves seeing what I’m doing. I like this wrap because it’s a little thicker than other wraps or there and it’s stretchy so my little one feels very supported. It’s maybe a little hot for summer, but I mainly use it around the house. Don’t feel overwhelmed by how to tie it, they provide instructions - OR you can just watch someone show you how to tie it on YouTube. Super easy!
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Great wrap for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I love this wrap! I tried a couple other wraps but they did not hold up to the Boba. I’m 5’2” and wear a size 16 and it fit great. I had a problem with some wraps not reaching around for the last tie in the front but had no issues with this one. Material is stretchy but still offered great support for the baby. I put her in it and she was snuggled up and asleep in no time. Recommend watching the videos online and practicing a couple times before adding the baby!
customer_reviews.author: Juliette

customer_reviews.title: Boba
customer_reviews.text: I love the idea of baby wearing and with the boba wrap it’s so soft and secure, its super comfortable. My take on the Boba Wrap is that it’s not that great for premies (which I didn’t expect my baby to come early) and for short people. But otherwise it’s perfect for babies with some weight on them, my baby is currently 4lbs. But it holds my nephew (he’s 13lbs) he loves being in it. Wrapping is a learning curve but worth it once you get it. It gets faster once it becomes a routine. I suggest youtube to learn how because it’s easier to see then read instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Truong

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome for preemies! I loved having it for when I needed my hands free. Material is soft and luxurious. Machine washable! Eventually I personally needed more support for my shoulders and back so I bought a Lillebaby but I am forever thankful for this wrap. Wraps are crazy long and can't be thrown on super fast when baby is upset (maybe they can and I am just not skilled in fast wrapping ways).
customer_reviews.author: rm

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to use and will last for years
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! It looks intimidating, but I had no problem using it the very first time after watching a YouTube video. It didn’t make me feel overwhelmingly hot even after a 4 mile walk. It’s the right amount of fabric to do a variety of wraps, ensure security and grow with your baby or even accommodate a toddler. Low cost and a great investment. Easy to breast feed with it on and easily slide baby in and out. I did my research and seasoned moms recommended this most. Glad I took the plunge. No more awkward and heavy carriers!
customer_reviews.author: Madelaine Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Great if you walk around alot or events
customer_reviews.text: This was great material and appeared it would not be to hot possibly, i just never tried during summer time. Was slightly hard to figure how to wrap but after watching videos figured out how to get baby in it. Would be nicer to have a video that showed also a real infant baby get inside to show how infant sits. Over all i did end up returning due to we did not use but only once and did not work out for us. I do suggest if you maybe to alot of events or walking that a stroller is not feasible. Great product though
customer_reviews.author: Patty K.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: The baby is not here yet but I am impressed with the fabric quality. Super soft and stretchy. I have practiced wrapping it around myself and the instructions are easy to follow. Can’t wait to use it with the little one. Update: Our baby has arrived and I love using this wrap with her. It feels like a comforting hug enveloping both of us. She falls asleep and stays asleep in this. It’s magical!
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: Looking forward to learning and using this wrap
customer_reviews.text: I’m 34 weeks pregnant and have been really excited to get a wrap for my baby. I watched so many tutorials for tying the wrap and read all the info about its material and size. 5.5 yards is pretty much the standard size for all wraps of this sort. However, I didn’t realize how HUGE that is! I guess you could say I’m tiny (135lbs at 34 weeks pregnant). But there was so much extra fabric when I practiced wrapping, even with my bump in the way. It’ll take time getting used to tying this wrap and having this a secure place for baby. I will update when baby is here and we’ve tried the wrap.
customer_reviews.author: shannon__alexis

customer_reviews.title: No baby yet but we like it so far!
customer_reviews.text: First thing we liked about the Boba is that it fits my husband with room to spare! He's 6'4 280 and built like a Mac truck (his nickname is Thor) it's soft stretchy and feels like high quality fabric though I don't have anything babybwrap wise to compare it to. I am 30 weeks and on bedrest so I've not given it a try yet. Seems easy enough to figure out. My husband figured it after a few tries on different techniques. I'll update once baby comes and we start using it as intended!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love the wrap but definitely couldn’t see me wearing it ...
customer_reviews.text: I love the wrap but definitely couldn’t see me wearing it in the summer or out and about. Maybe if I’d gotten black I’d consider wearing it out in the fall. It’s not difficult to use but I do notice that my daughter drops down lower when she’s been in there for a while, but that could just be me not tying it tight enough. This is baby #4 for me and is definitely the most comfortable baby carrier I’ve ever had because I can distribute the weight to make it more comfortable. I’m a SAHM for now and having her in the wrap enables me to get more done around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Shenelle

customer_reviews.title: Dont give up on it if you cant get it right the first time!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after I tried putting my baby in a different carrier and he didnt seem to like it. I tried for weeks to get the hang of this one using the instruction manual and it felt way too loose. It wasnt until I found a video in YouTube with EASY instructions that I finally was able to get a tight fit and baby was super happy in it. I am so glad I didnt give up! baby is 9 lbs and I am 5 ft 98 lbs!
customer_reviews.author: Cin

customer_reviews.title: Very well received shower gift.
customer_reviews.text: This specific wrap was requested by a friend on their baby registry at a particular retailer, who happened to be out of stock. Amazon & their sellers again coming thru for me. The mommy to be was very happy & I think getting her the one she asked for was a winner. The color & design were what drew her to this. Can't wait to see its future passenger! lol
customer_reviews.author: Donna McManus

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put baby and baby loves it
customer_reviews.text: I had high expectations on this product being a moby wrap user 5 years ago with my first son . So bec of the great reviews i really thought it is a better product but because of the stretchy fabric , my second baby who is two months old now goes down low no matter how tight and how high i put him in the wrap . This results with my back aching . I do love the ease of putting the baby on and my baby loves it once he is in . Over all i wouldnt recommend it to a friend . But for use around the house this is nice because its easy to put on .
customer_reviews.author: Kaye S

customer_reviews.title: Material is too heavy and is very warm. Not suitable for tropical climate
customer_reviews.text: Unbelievably hot. I do not recommend this product if you live in a tropical climate. I keep the thermostat at 70° F at home and it was still way too hot and the baby was sweating after only five minutes in my home. I can't imagine what it would be like if i took her outside to the garden. Unfortunately this product doesn't work for me. It was very cute and easy to use, but the material is just too warm for the baby and I.
customer_reviews.author: Tatiana M.

customer_reviews.title: Will never recommend
customer_reviews.text: Unsure how this got so many great reviews. This wrap is a pain. There’s so much material. It’s confusing to put on. I’m in awe how you’re actually suppose to put a newborn into the wrap...while it’s tight...while supporting the head...while trying to tame their wiggly bodies...while basically using one arm. This is one of the most frustrating baby products I’ve ever used.
customer_reviews.author: rachelisesmith

customer_reviews.title: Best baby wrap!
customer_reviews.text: I had a baby ktan for my first because I wasn’t interested in all the extra fabric. When I tried using it for my second however, the fabric was all stretched out and she just didn’t seem secure. I did a lot of research on different wraps and decided to go with the boba. I am so glad I did, the stretch and breath ability is perfect and my baby feels so secure.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Fabric is not breathable at all
customer_reviews.text: The wrap is as described, great material and quality, there is a lot of fabric and I'm 5'10" so I imagine it could be overwhelming for anyone on the shorter side. My biggest issue is the heat. The fabric is not breathable at all and my son runs very warm. He hated being in this wrap but was happy to be in a much lighter weight wrap that was gifted to me. We also live in south FL so no way would I be able to wear him in this wrap while outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Santos

customer_reviews.title: The fabric is HEAVENLY! Best wrap I’ve tried!
customer_reviews.text: Literally my FAVORITE wrap for the stretch and material of the fabric it’s also much longer than most wraps so I can get it to comfortably wrap around myself a few times and tie tight with extra fabric! I love whatever material it is and so does my son! I’m returning my baby ktan and ordering a second boba to have one at home and one on the go! LOVE LOVE LOVE! Wish I got one sooner
customer_reviews.author: Colleen Custodio

customer_reviews.title: My lifesaver!
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't tell you how many different wraps and carriers I have tried without success until I found this one! My little didnt like all of the structure pr fabric between us - this one let's her cuddle right up to my chest and is tight like a swaddle. It also helps to keep her warm since it's still winter here. I seriously wont leave the house without it! It takes a few tries to learn how to wrap it, but once you figure it out you're golden.
customer_reviews.author: Suzzette

customer_reviews.title: Good for around the house
customer_reviews.text: This wrap carrier worked well when my son was first born. Easy to learn how to wrap around you as it comes with instructions. Very soft and breathable. Doesn’t hurt my back quite as bad as other carriers. I did not like using it in public much because it is so long and drags on the ground when you are trying to wrap it. Don’t want ground germs on my baby! Was not able to use it as much once he got older (about 3months) due to the size of him!
customer_reviews.author: LaneHA

customer_reviews.title: Adequate
customer_reviews.text: Once you get the hang of tying it, it’s not so bad. It’s really warm...like baby sweating and stuck to your skin warm in the summer, spring and fall. It’s nice and cuddly for winter! It’s way too much of a hassle to wear anywhere except for the house. But it’s nice and comfortable for doing chores around the house. Not my first choice, but my baby will go in it and it works alright. Definitely wouldn’t wear it if I needed to carry her for more than an hour. It’s pretty great for getting my little one to fall asleep while I’m doing laundry and then I can sit down with her napping in it/on me.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Anderson

customer_reviews.title: A lifesaver for my newborn
customer_reviews.text: This wrap was is a lifesaver when my newborn only wants to be held. The only issue I have is that she becomes extremely sweaty while in it. It is a very soft material but also very thick. It takes some practice to get it on but once you get the hang of it, it’s very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Susanjane VanDament

customer_reviews.title: Don't be afraid, give it a try! You won't be dissapointed!
customer_reviews.text: Okay, I LOVE this thing. I used to be extremely skeptical over the wrap type carriers due to security but I was blown away. It takes a few tries to get it right but once you figure it out (like tying a scarf) it becomes second nature. It's easy (as uncoordinated as I am) and comfortable. I like how close my baby is to me and how nursing accessible it is while carrying. The fabric will stretch a bit but after some readjusting it's back to normal! I'm fully impressed. The price is amazing and the product outshines the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Lea S

customer_reviews.title: Watch YouTube videos & learn! You won’t regret it! 5stars!
customer_reviews.text: So far so great! Feels amazing. Once you learn how to use it it literally is a life saver. My baby is already 12 months! & before I had been using a carrier that clips and buckles. Etc. but my hips would hurt. My back. This wrap allows my baby to act as if she’s just apart of my body. So much more comfort and it looks cute too! My daughter loves it and does great in it. We took her all 3 days to the LA coffee festival and it was a breeze with the wrap. I bought it specifically for this! Thank goodness I did!
customer_reviews.author: Desire

customer_reviews.title: A must have for new moms!
customer_reviews.text: This is an absolute lifesaver! Our baby only wants to be held, this allows me to get things done while he snoozes and snuggles. He absolutely loves it! A little tricky to get on at first, but you’ll quickly get the hang of it. There are some awesome YouTube video instructions. He’s also spit up on it several times and it washes beautifully! He’s now almost 3 months and still loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Graham

customer_reviews.title: My baby loves this and so does my plus sized body!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second wrap carrier I bought. My son hated the first one, and this one was more expensive, but I really need to be able to baby wear, so I figured it was worth a shot. First of all, this material is slightly stretchy, so it is easier to wrap and to put baby into. Second, it is long enough that I have plenty of space to tie the end, and I am a size 18 right now. Finally, my son actually loves this. I put him in it and he sleeps for hours while I get work done. It is truly amazing. I am about to buy a second one!
customer_reviews.author: MedicMommy

customer_reviews.title: Worth It!
customer_reviews.text: Its a bit hot for Central Texas but I keep baby in lightweight onesies and use it mainly indoors so that he doesnt get too hot. I love it. I have used it mainly aroubd my house to get him settled and so I can have hands again! Took only 3 or 4 attempts to get it the way I like and now its super easy!
customer_reviews.author: Jez'Reel

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Easier than I thought it would be to use! Only took me one try to figure it out. Absolutely essential for me at about the 2 week point to be able to get anything done around the house with a newborn who fought sleep. This allowed me to have at least one free hand to be able to do simple things like put dishes away or throw dinner together. Easy care instructions and definitely soothing for our baby who loved the swaddle. She would often fall asleep in this! That said, at 10 weeks we have moved from this to a more structured carrier, like the lille, but this was worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Ott

customer_reviews.title: baby loves it
customer_reviews.text: Baby hated the Tula. Ordered the Boba as a last ditch effort. The fabric feels like it’s a million miles long and the instructions in the book seem hard to follow (I’m a visual learner) but the YouTube videos made it easier to understand. The wrap makes it very easy to get things done when she wants to be held.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how I’ve had two other kids and not had this wrap. My son loves it. If he’s fussy he calms down as soon as I put him in it. It takes some time to learn how to wear it correctly but there are plenty of you tube tutorials. I have told everyone I know about this thing and how amazing it is.
customer_reviews.author: jbeygirls

customer_reviews.title: My daughter loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter just had a baby who loves to snuggle. This was a perfect option for multitasking since she is working from home.
customer_reviews.author: Donelle M. Goerlitz

customer_reviews.title: Did not give the support I thought it would
customer_reviews.text: I know it is supposed to be easy to use but I could never remember how to wrap the dang thing. Also, it is hot and did not feel completely comfortable. I had a section and it it did not give me the support needed it ended up killing my back just using it for a couple of hours. I ended up getting the ergo baby 360 and had more support plus super easy to use and hold baby multiple positions.
customer_reviews.author: Kandy

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: As other reviews stated, the wrap will make you and baby hot if the weather is even slightly warm. That being said, I have no intentions of taking baby on a hike in this so that has not become a problem yet. It’s easy to use, and very comfortable while still being very supportive. It’s best to put it on before leaving the house to avoid an awkward delay once at your destination.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica R.

customer_reviews.title: A must have for any parent
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have for any parent! I’m gonna start saying that the color it’s so beautiful and after a few washes it seems the same. So useful when you need to do stuff around the house and have to use both hands!!! (Even if you can make them with just one) The material it’s nice and thick. I’m in south Florida and the thickness can be an issue to use it outside, my baby ends up sweating just like me but if you are in a nicer climate it’s perfect. My husband uses it to hold her while he play his video games and she instantly fall asleep.
customer_reviews.author: Morelu Moratinos

customer_reviews.title: Definitely get one. Life saver.
customer_reviews.text: I used to think bobas were stupid, until I got a boba. Literally a life saver. I just wrap my son up and boom - he falls right asleep. I feel like this is ideal for new babies. I’m not sure how it’s gonna do once he’s older (he’s 2 1/2 months now) but for now it’s awesome. It doesn’t hurt my back and I can wear it for 2+ hours (AS LONG as you do it correctly.) it comes with a directions book but I’d definitely recommend watching a YouTube video instead and save yourself some time.
customer_reviews.author: Mudcat51

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product. The directions seemed a little confusing, but I looked up a tutorial on YouTube and was able to figure it out. It’s great to use when traveling and keeps my son nice and snug. He’s usually out within minutes. And I don’t feel like I have to keep supporting his head because if strapped in right he’s good to go. And I can do all my cleaning and errands and not have to lug around a heavy car seat.
customer_reviews.author: Angelique Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Secure and snug
customer_reviews.text: My baby loves being wrapped snuggly in this wrap! I love being able to carry her hands-free as well. It's a very long piece of cloth, and is very comfortable once on. The instructions that come with it show a few different ways to wrap based on baby's size/weight which is great, you will definitely get a good amount of time's worth out of this. Baby feels very secure in it, and she actually usually just falls right to sleep! I am tempted to get more in more colors because this wrap works so well! Love the Boba Wrap!
customer_reviews.author: Diana M. Schumann

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: This has been a lifesaver! It was so easy to figure out how to use. Baby is comfortable in it and allows for snuggle time when needing to get some work done. So glad we got this.
customer_reviews.author: Victor Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Great wrap
customer_reviews.text: Love my boba wrap! When my baby is being fussy putting him in this wrap instantly calms him and he falls asleep pretty quickly. Perfect for days when he doesn't want me to put him down and I want to get things done. It can get hot though.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa D.

customer_reviews.title: Sooo essential for newborn that constantly wants to be held!!
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for a momma with a newborn. I have both hands available to help my toddler out while still holding my 2 week old close and comfy! This alone gave me the confidence I soooo needed to handle young kiddos by myself daily. I love it so much!! I will say, my pediatrician said not to abuse it, and to use it for less than an hour a day. It also hurts my back after like 45 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Allison Erdmann

customer_reviews.title: Necessary for baby number 2 so busy mom can use her arms! 😊
customer_reviews.text: Originally bought the k’tan because these wraps overwhelmed me. But I was in between sizes and decided to try this after watching YouTube videos. I am SO HAPPY I DID! The only way I can get anything done, get through the witching hours and how I got through weeks 3-6 when I though my baby was colicky. The fabric is soft and stretchy, though it would be hot for summer months. I highly recommend this wrap!!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa30

customer_reviews.title: Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: It's super long but so convenient. Takes a bit to get used to to get the wrapping down. Bought to use for my twins. Havent put them both in it, but individually they love it. It's like the womb for them. Worth the buy.
customer_reviews.author: MamaKar3

customer_reviews.title: Special Purchase
customer_reviews.text: So happy with this purchase! It's so perfect for a busy mom who needs to get things done at home or when she's out & about & still be able to feel that spcial closeness that she & baby can share together. The Boba feels comfortable & secure for both mom & baby.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Affordable, convenient
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing. Looking at other wraps had my head spinning from the prices but I was pleasantly surprised to see how affordable the boba wrap is, especially with how highly it was rated. Watching videos was helpful in how to use this. It's nice to have my baby so close to me and to keep touchy strangers from trying to touch him. I'm still getting used to it but I did find that having it on for an extended period of time did cause me some low back pain.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: If you’re going to buy a baby wrap, make it this one
customer_reviews.text: Don’t be intimidated by wraps! Super easy to pull on and/or take with you anywhere. Baby is cozy and comfortable without overheating. Material is soft and stretchy compared to other brand name wraps without the crazy price tag.
customer_reviews.author: JSON

customer_reviews.title: Soft material
customer_reviews.text: Pretty comfortable and easy to put on. I tried following the instructions on the pamphlet but it was difficult to follow. But watching the video it made it easier to put on and use. This wrap is super long and large so if you have a small baby or are petite this may not be the wrap for you.
customer_reviews.author: Bruno

customer_reviews.title: Best thing ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: The Boba wrap has made my first week with a newborn fantastic! I would recommend practicing putting on before your baby arrives. Youtube videos- watch how to boba wrap and boba wrap newborn. This wrap is a one size fits all and inexpensive option for baby wearing which they love. Note smaller babies like mine must do 'frog legs' inside the wrap instead of feet out to the side. Much nicer than leaving the baby wrapped in a swaddle in bassinet all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Dann J.

customer_reviews.title: Loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for a friend of mine as a baby shower gift. She has since had her baby and told me just the other day she would recommend this sling to anyone. Her exact quote to me was "I tell everyone, I didn't even know I needed this until I got it and used it. Now I tell everyone You NEED a boba wrap!" She said she would get one of these as a gift fir everyone she knew that was having a baby. Yay! She loves it.
customer_reviews.author: mandy taylor

customer_reviews.title: Adore this wrap!
customer_reviews.text: This is super comfy to wear. My baby loves it. She instantly falls asleep which allows me to grocery shop and get housework done while keeping my baby close and safe. It can be complicated to wrap at first, but the directions are helpful, and once you’ve done it a few times, it becomes quick and easy. I would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: GEM

customer_reviews.title: Plus size momma approved
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product..its soft and stretchy and it fits! Im a plus size momma so I was worried about how it was going to work out but im happy. Im only putting 4 stars because while it did what it was supposed to I could only ware it for a short time as my little started to sweat and I started to get warm my self. I live in AZ so im hoping as it gets cooler I may be able to use it more
customer_reviews.author: Fmz

customer_reviews.title: LOOOOOOVE
customer_reviews.text: Omg this thing changed our lives. I will buy one of these for every baby shower I ever attend. Our baby is a month and is colicky. When he starts screaming inconsolably, we put him in this and he instantly calms. He hates being swaddled, but love this wrap. I think because he can be skin to skin with me. It’s a little hot, but our house stays on the cooler side. Haven’t had a chance to try this in the summer yet.
customer_reviews.author: Vbess

customer_reviews.title: No Way
customer_reviews.text: Complicated and cumbersome to put on. You need about 4 hands to safely install and remove the baby from the wrap. Especially difficult to manage with a small newborn. Watched plenty of instructional videos and read instructions but found it very difficult to support infant's head and wrestle with the wrap. Seems dangerous to me.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Minor

customer_reviews.title: It is totally worth learning how to tie it.
customer_reviews.text: I was scared to try this, because I didn't think I could tie it properly. Turns out it is really simple to tie and very sturdy. My baby loves it; he doesn't move when he is in the wrap.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: I SO WANTED TO LOVE but I couldn't
customer_reviews.text: I gave it a shot several times. I really wanted to love this product but it is so hard to use. My fiance always had to help me set it up. Maybe I'm just dumb. Or bad at following directions. He had no problem using it but he works full time and I would be the one needing to baby carry, not him. And I cant always have him help me so it's not practical. So hard to use!
customer_reviews.author: Amazonshopper61

customer_reviews.title: Thank you Boba!
customer_reviews.text: I had an issue with my initial Boba where a strings were snagged inside (see pic above) Boba reached out and they mentioned this should have not happened. The quickly offered to replace my item. They also mentioned how they offer a free session with baby wearing expert. Recieved new Boba with no defects. It is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Ellie V

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and cozy!
customer_reviews.text: This is so amazing to have once you’ve mastered the wrap. My baby always falls asleep within minutes of being bundled up inside and allows me to be hands free for light tasks around the house. Also the way she is cradled inside gives an idea of how cozy she was when she was still in my tummy.
customer_reviews.author: Giselle

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: I love these wraps. This is my first one from This company. Fairly breathable, I live in Michigan and for summer months I would rather be wearing the moby flex wrap since it’s way more breathable than this. This is still breathable but it’s got a heavy sort of stretch fabric to it. Feels secure but definitely kinda hot for summer. Overall I would repurchase this product as I feel like it does the job well.
customer_reviews.author: Chauncey

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and comfortable!!
customer_reviews.text: Wrap is very convenient to use. I can’t compare to other body wraps as I’ve just tried this, but it allows me to carry my baby around thr house and free my hands. My advice is to check out how to use it on YouTube rather than the manual that comes with it. The only reason I give this four-star is because the color gray is duller in real life as compared to the picture.
customer_reviews.author: Sybille K

customer_reviews.title: Great but short lived.
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this when my daughter was a newborn. She did not like the baby bajorn or to be put down for that matter and would easily fall asleep in this. This kept her snug and I was able to get some light chores done. Now that she is older it’s very hard to get it to where she is up and close to me so for that reason I’m giving it 4 stars since she’s only 4 months and only really last the newborn stage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'd recommend
customer_reviews.text: I love this soft wrap. It's really easy to use however it'll take some practice to get fast at it (at least for me) on another note it says grey in color however for me it's a little bit more like a light olive but it does match the picture I just would not have labeled it the color grey. Oh and my newborn loves it and falls right to sleep nice and snug and I'm still able to move around freely and hands free as much as I'd like.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Rodriguez-Massey

customer_reviews.title: Great for Baby's First 6 Months
customer_reviews.text: I really loved this from newborn to about six months. After that, my baby was maybe a little too big for it to be as comfortable for me anymore. It was great for shopping, running errands, or getting things done around the house. I found it practical to put it on before going out, then moved my baby from the car seat to the wrap. He was always so content in it, and I found it more practical than a stroller, in terms of overall mobility/multitasking.
customer_reviews.author: keyboard

customer_reviews.title: Cozy, learning curve, but my newborn loves it once figured out!
customer_reviews.text: I used a carrier with my older child and wanted to branch out into the baby wearing trend with my second. This has been wonderful so far! After using an instructional video to help me figure out how to use it (there are plenty on YouTube that explain better than the brand website), I felt comfortable and confident to put it on, and have used it nearly daily since my son's birth. It is wonderful to have the ability to use both hands and cook, clean, etc. As a bonus, my son loves it and falls asleep almost immediately whenever placed in it.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Keefer

product_meta.title: Boba Wrap Baby Carrier, Grey - Original Stretchy Infant Sling, Perfect for Newborn Babies and Children up to 35 lbs
feature_bullets: Simple, no-guess tying instructions and just one size make this wrap your GO-TO BABY CARRIER for the first three months of parenthood <3 It was the first of its kind and the simplicity of the idea has kept moms and babies together for 10 years.

Stretchy and SOFT, machine washable fabric that will keep your baby close. So much easier to clean than a stroller or carseat! You can machine wash and dry this wrap, making life just a little easier for new moms.
ERGONOMIC seat for baby, ergonomic weight distribution for mom and dad! Each time you tie the wrap, you create a CUSTOM seat for your baby. Knee to knee support every time!
EASY to tie and easy to breastfeed in. It even acts as a privacy shield for nursing moms because you can nurse while wearing it, without taking your baby out of the wrap.

Bond with your little one while getting back into the swing of things: you'll be able to tie this once and then wear it out and about. 95% Cotton, the Spandex in our wrap allows it to retain its shape and not loosen or sag as you re-adjust to nurse or take baby out to go for a ride in the car. Just like your favorite yoga pants, the wrap stretches and supports you and your baby.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars7,470 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
